Best way to reach me is via E-Mail.

Research Interests

I am interested in a wide variety of topics ranging from robotics, control, dynamical systems and machine learning and particularly where these areas overlap.

Biography

I am a doctoral assistant at the Laboratory of Intelligent Systems at EPFL, under the guidance of Dario Floreano. I hold a Bachelor’s and Master’s degree in Mechatronics from University of Stuttgart and was a visiting student at Peter the Great St. Petersburg Polytechnic University.

During my academic journey, I have actively engaged in various intriguing projects. At Greenteam Uni Stuttgart, I designed mechanical components of a high-performance electric race car. In a research thesis, I was working on activity recognition algorithms of biomechanical motion data for improving the control of upper-body exoskeletons at Fraunhofer IPA. I developed as intern a demonstrator for distributed control concepts in the dynamic systems control group at Robert Bosch GmbH. At Max Planck Institute for Intelligent Systems, I worked with Dieter Büchler on the improvement of the capabilities of a muscle-based table tennis robot.
